answers.text:
Anaheim, CA, Arvada, CO, and Hayward, CA use a product from Government Outreach (www.govoutreach.com) based in Pleasanton, CA.  They have a product that fits your requirements.  They also have both an iApp and Android interface for citizen use.  I really like their product and very cost effective.
Clancy Priest, CIO (retired)
Hayward, CA

Good morning Jessica,
App-Order.com provides an end-to-end system for managing Citizen Requests and communication.  Our system is affordable, scalable, and capable of integrating into existing systems if needed.  Citizens make requests through your branded public application (available for free to the public on Google Play and in the App Store).  You decide what informational items are required, such as an Issue Type, GPS location, and/or photos, and which are optional, such as a text or audio note.   Reporters can provide contact information to receive status updates and other communications
Once received, City Staff manage requests through a login-based mobile management app or through our browser-based Management Portal.  Rule-based notifications allow automatic routing of Requests to the proper individual or department for resolution, based on the Issue Type and other relevant criteria.  
Each piece of your system is customized based on your needs, so give us a call for more information or to get started.  You can reach me directly at jeremy@app-order.com or (805) 203-6221.  Talk to you soon!

author: Jessica Roth
text:
Our City is interested in launching a mobile app.  First and foremost, we want citizens to be able to report problems/concerns, along the lines of a 311 reporting system.  We'd also like to offer other useful features so it's not just a 311 app, but has a broader appeal and is another tool to reach out to our citizens.  We're not a tourism destination so these features should be useful and interesting to the average resident.  I'm interested in information on the following:
1)  Do you have a specific 311-type app that you can recommend?  I'm familiar with See Click Fix so I'm looking for other options - not opposed to See Click Fix, just want to understand all the options out there.
2)  Does your City have an app?  If so, what features do you think are beneficial and have been well used by your residents?
3)  Can you recommend any app development companies?
Thanks in advance for any information that can be shared.
Jessica Roth
City of Suwanee, GA
